structured.description: A Spring Boot configuration class named `CorsConfig` that enables CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) functionality for a web application. The class contains a single method `corsConfigurer()` that returns a `WebMvcConfigurer` bean, which adds CORS mappings to the Spring MVC configuration. The mappings allow requests from specified origins, methods, and headers, while also exposing credentials.

items.description: Is used to configure Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) settings for a Spring MVC web application. The class provides a way to define allowed origins, methods, headers, and credentials for CORS mapping. The @Bean annotation is used to create an instance of WebMvcConfigurer, which adds CORS mappings to the registry.
items.name: CorsConfig

items.description: Configures Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) settings for a web application, allowing requests from specified origins and methods, and exposing specific headers.

returns.description:
a configuration for CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) that allows access to resources from any origin, with specific allowed methods and headers.

* `allowedOrigins`: An array of origins that are allowed to make requests to the server.
* `allowedMethods`: An array of HTTP methods that are allowed to be used in requests from allowed origins.
* `allowedHeaders`: An array of header fields that are allowed to be used in responses from the server.
* `exposedHeaders`: An array of header fields that are exposed to clients in responses.
* `allowCredentials`: A boolean value indicating whether credentials (e.g., cookies, authorization headers) should be included in requests.

usage.description: The code above would enable CORS for all requests to the server, allowing any origin, methods, headers and credentials.

items.name: corsConfigurer

items.description: Adds mapping to the CORS registry, allowing requests from any origin and including specific headers and methods. It also sets allow credentials to true.

params.name: registry
params.description: CorsRegistry object where methods are added to configure CORS settings for the application.

items.name: addCorsMappings
